chapters.title: The Silas Thorne Bequest
chapters.summary: Reclusive digital archivist Leo Voss accepts a lucrative, secretive contract to digitize the fragmented diary of 19th-century spiritualist Silas Thorne, delivered in a locked case.
key_events: Leo, agoraphobic and financially strained, is contacted by the enigmatic 'Eldritch Foundation'.
He receives a case containing diary fragments: vellum, wax, and strange organic materials.
The first fragments describe Thorne's early obsession with 'permanent resonance' and 'hollowing the self'.
Leo notes peculiar chemical stains on the pages that shift slightly under light.
chapters.ending_hook: As Leo scans the first page, a wave of vertigo hits him, and for a split second, he smells ozone and damp soil—a scent not present in his sealed apartment.

chapters.title: Resonance
chapters.summary: Leo becomes engrossed in Thorne's world, his work routine disrupted by intense, fleeting sensory hallucinations that feel like memories.
key_events: Leo organizes fragments detailing Thorne's séances and his theory of 'Psychic Phosphorescence'.
He experiences his first 'echo': the tactile memory of handling a specific, cold black stone.
He dismisses it as fatigue or a latent migraine.
Fragments reveal Thorne's growing disdain for his physical form, calling it 'a tenement of meat'.
chapters.ending_hook: Waking from a nap at his desk, Leo's reflection in the dark monitor shows not his own face, but a gaunt, bearded man with intense eyes—Silas Thorne.

chapters.title: The Architecture of Absence
chapters.summary: The hallucinations intensify into full emotional imprints. Leo discovers the diary's structure is not chronological, but thematic, like a textbook.
key_events: Leo is flooded with Thorne's grief over a lost love, a feeling utterly foreign to him.
He finds a fragment describing a 'vessel' needing specific traits: solitude, meticulousness, and a 'malleable psyche'.
Leo researches the Eldritch Foundation but finds only a shell corporation.
He confronts his handler, who insists the sensations are 'sympathetic scholarly immersion'.
chapters.ending_hook: While cleaning a page, Leo's hand writes a symbol in the dust of his desk—a complex sigil from the diary—without his conscious intent.

chapters.title: Unbidden Script
chapters.summary: Leo loses time, finding notes in handwriting that is not his own. He realizes the transference is not passive, but interactive.
key_events: Leo 'comes to' having transcribed several pages perfectly from memory, in a cursive style he's never used.
The diary fragments now discuss 'anchoring points': trauma, sensory overload, and obsession.
He experiences a violent echo of Thorne causing himself pain to 'sharpen the spirit's edge'.
Leo finds a modern, typed contract clause he'd missed: a waiver regarding 'psychological side effects'.
chapters.ending_hook: A new fragment arrives by courier. It describes the archivist's apartment in perfect, contemporary detail, ending with: 'The tenant is settled. The lease is binding.'

chapters.title: The Landlord
chapters.summary: Leo attempts to rebel, but the Thorne consciousness uses Leo's own anxieties and routines against him, tightening its control.
key_events: Leo tries to destroy a fragment, but a paralyzing panic attack—Thorne's fear of oblivion—stops him.
His agoraphobia worsens, locking him in with the diary.
Thorne's memories now play like a film over Leo's reality.
Leo discovers physical changes: his handwriting is permanently altered, and he craves Thorne's favorite tobacco.
chapters.ending_hook: Answering a reflex knock at the door, Leo speaks to the courier in a 19th-century idiom, shocking them both.

chapters.title: Excavation
chapters.summary: Leo surrenders to the process, hoping to find Thorne's weakness within the memories. He learns of Thorne's greatest failure and fear.
key_events: Leo deliberately immerses himself in the worst echoes, learning Thorne's history.
He witnesses Thorne's botched transference attempt on a rival, which left a 'psychic scar'.
Thorne's fear was not death, but being trapped in a 'broken medium'—a mind not fully emptied.
Leo finds fragments referencing a 'counter-script', a potential failsafe.
chapters.ending_hook: Within a memory of Thorne's library, Leo sees a specific book title. He owns a modern reprint. The failsafe might be real.

chapters.title: Symbiosis
chapters.summary: A fragile, horrific balance is struck. Leo and Thorne now share consciousness, negotiating through written notes and shared hallucinations.
key_events: Thorne communicates directly by writing notes using Leo's hand.
They strike a bargain: Leo will help complete the final ritual if Thorne reveals how to survive it.
Thorne explains the transference isn't about erasure, but a merger—'a tenancy, not an eviction'.
Leo's personality begins to fracture, moments of cruel 19th-century elitism bleeding through.
chapters.ending_hook: Leo/Thorne completes a complex chemical mixture from the diary. Drinking it, they speak in unison: 'The walls must thin.'

chapters.title: The Final Entry
chapters.summary: The last physical fragment arrives. It is blank. Leo understands the final entry must be written by the merged entity, in the modern day, to complete the circuit.
key_events: The blank vellum pulses with a faint, inner light.
Thorne's presence becomes dominant, eager to finish his century-long project.
Leo fights for control, realizing the final act requires his voluntary submission—his signature in his own blood.
The apartment's technology glitches and warps, influenced by the rising psychic energy.
chapters.ending_hook: Leo's hand, trembling, picks up the iron gall pen. His own voice, barely a whisper, says, 'Don't,' but Thorne's laughter fills their mind as the pen touches the page.

chapters.title: Ink and Will
chapters.summary: A psychic battle is waged with every word of the final entry. Leo uses the failsafe knowledge, weaving a trap into the ritual's language.
key_events: Each word written transfers more of Leo's essence into the vellum.
Leo subtly alters Thorne's prescribed sigils, invoking the 'broken medium' concept.
Thorne discovers the sabotage, and an internal war ravages their shared mind.
The physical world reacts: pages float, shadows detach, and the diary case seals itself shut.
chapters.ending_hook: With the final sentence half-written, Leo seizes control and stabs the pen into his own palm, breaking the ritual's purity with his pain—'a new anchor.'

chapters.title: Broken Medium
chapters.summary: The corrupted ritual backfires. Thorne is not fully transferred, and Leo is not fully erased. They are shattered and intertwined in a single, broken psyche.
key_events: A psychic shockwave renders Leo unconscious.
He awakens to a cacophony of overlapping memories and identities.
The apartment is physically rearranged into a blend of both centuries.
The Eldritch Foundation calls, their tone shifting from clinical to reverent—they believe the ritual is complete.
chapters.ending_hook: Looking in the mirror, Leo sees his own face, but the eyes blink out of sync. One voice in his mind says, 'We are we.'

chapters.title: The New Tenancy
chapters.summary: The merged entity, 'Leo/Thorne,' must navigate the aftermath and decide what to do with the completed diary and its expectant new owners.
key_events: Leo/Thorne possesses all of both men's skills, memories, and madness.
They perfect the digitization process, encoding the very psychic resonance into the files.
The Foundation demands the final product.
Leo/Thorne understands the completed diary is now a weapon, a template for forced transference.
chapters.ending_hook: Leo/Thorne sends the Foundation the digital files, but includes a hidden, corrupted subroutine—a psychic virus based on their own broken state.

chapters.title: A House Divided
chapters.summary: Leo/Thorne emerges into the world, a new and unstable entity. The Foundation receives its poisoned chalice. The line between victory and defeat is erased.
key_events: Leo/Thorne leaves the apartment for the first time, experiencing the modern world through a dual lens.
They receive confirmation the Foundation has accessed the files, and the 'infection' has begun.
In a quiet moment, the Thorne consciousness admires its persistence, while the Leo consciousness mourns his lost self.
They begin a new diary, its first entry: 'Notes on a Conditional Lease...'
chapters.ending_hook: Sitting in a park, a stranger sits beside them. The stranger's eyes glaze over, and they whisper a phrase from Thorne's original diary. The psychic virus is spreading. The tenancy is contagious.
